      • supportsMultipleCarets

        public boolean supportsMultipleCarets()
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Tells whether multiple coexisting carets are supported by this CaretModel instance. Multiple carets are not supported when the corresponding Editor instance is a facade over a Swing JTextArea component.
        Specified by:
        supportsMultipleCarets in interface CaretModel

      • getCurrentCaret

        public CaretImpl getCurrentCaret()
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Returns current caret - the one, query and update methods in the model operate at the moment. In the current implementation this is either an iteration-current caret within the context of CaretModel.runForEachCaret(CaretAction) method, or the 'primary' caret without that context. Users CaretModel.runForEachCaret(CaretAction) method should use caret parameter passed to CaretAction.perform(Caret) method instead of this method, as the definition of current caret (as well as caret instance operated on by model methods) can potentially change.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentCaret in interface CaretModel

        public CaretImpl getPrimaryCaret()
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Returns the 'primary' caret.
        Specified by:

      • addCaret

        public Caret addCaret(VisualPosition pos,
                      boolean makePrimary)
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Adds a new caret at the given position, and returns corresponding Caret instance. Locations outside of possible values for the given document are trimmed automatically. Newly added caret will become a primary caret if and only if makePrimary value is true. Does nothing if multiple carets are not supported, a caret already exists at specified location or selection of existing caret includes the specified location, null is returned in this case.
        Specified by:
        addCaret in interface CaretModel

      • addCaret

        public Caret addCaret(LogicalPosition pos,
                      boolean makePrimary)
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Adds a new caret at the given position, and returns corresponding Caret instance. Locations outside of possible values for the given document are trimmed automatically. Newly added caret will become a primary caret if and only if makePrimary value is true. Does nothing if multiple carets are not supported, a caret already exists at specified location or selection of existing caret includes the specified location, null is returned in this case.
        Specified by:
        addCaret in interface CaretModel

      • removeCaret

        public boolean removeCaret(Caret caret)
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Removes a given caret if it's recognized by the model and is not the only existing caret in the document, returning true. false is returned if any of the above condition doesn't hold, and the removal cannot happen.
        Specified by:
        removeCaret in interface CaretModel

      • runForEachCaret

        public void runForEachCaret(CaretAction action)
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Same as CaretModel.runForEachCaret(CaretAction, boolean) with reverseOrder set to false
        Specified by:
        runForEachCaret in interface CaretModel

      • runForEachCaret

        public void runForEachCaret(CaretAction action,
                            boolean reverseOrder)
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Executes the given task for each existing caret. Set of carets to iterate over is determined in the beginning and is not affected by the potential carets addition or removal by the task being executed. At the end, merging of carets and selections is performed, so that no two carets will occur at the same logical position and no two selection will overlap after this method is finished.

        Carets are iterated in position order (top-to-bottom) if reverseOrder is false, and in reverse order if it's true.

        It's possible to call this method not from EDT (for read-only operations). Caret merging is not performed in this case, and no notifications to CaretActionListener-s are sent.

        Specified by:
        runForEachCaret in interface CaretModel

      • addCaretActionListener

        public void addCaretActionListener(CaretActionListener listener,
                                   Disposable disposable)
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Adds a listener which will be notified before and after all-caret operations are performed by CaretModel.runForEachCaret(CaretAction) and CaretModel.runForEachCaret(CaretAction, boolean). Listeners will be notified only if those methods are invoked from EDT (non-EDT invocations are not allowed to change caret state anyway).
        Specified by:
        addCaretActionListener in interface CaretModel

      • runBatchCaretOperation

        public void runBatchCaretOperation(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Executes the given task, performing caret merging afterwards. Caret merging will not happen until the operation is finished.
        Specified by:
        runBatchCaretOperation in interface CaretModel

      • setCaretsAndSelections

        public void setCaretsAndSelections(java.util.List<? extends CaretState> caretStates)
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Sets the number of carets, their positions and selection ranges according to the provided data. Null values for caret position or selection boundaries will mean that corresponding caret's position and/or selection won't be changed.

        System selection will be updated, if such feature is supported by current editor.

        Specified by:
        setCaretsAndSelections in interface CaretModel
        See Also:
        CaretModel.supportsMultipleCarets(), CaretModel.getCaretsAndSelections(), CaretModel.setCaretsAndSelections(List, boolean)

      • setCaretsAndSelections

        public void setCaretsAndSelections(java.util.List<? extends CaretState> caretStates,
                                   boolean updateSystemSelection)
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Sets the number of carets, their positions and selection ranges according to the provided data. Null values for caret position or selection boundaries will mean that corresponding caret's position and/or selection won't be changed.

        System selection will be updated, if such feature is supported by current editor and corresponding invocation parameter is set to true.

        Specified by:
        setCaretsAndSelections in interface CaretModel
        See Also:
        CaretModel.supportsMultipleCarets(), CaretModel.getCaretsAndSelections()

      • getCaretsAndSelections

        public java.util.List<CaretState> getCaretsAndSelections()
        Description copied from interface: CaretModel
        Returns the current positions of all carets and their selections. The order of entries in the returned list does not necessarily correspond to the order of CaretModel.getAllCarets() method results. Passing the result of this method to CaretModel.setCaretsAndSelections(List) will restore the state of carets, including the internal caret order, in particular, the caret, that was primary when this method was called, will be the primary one after corresponding CaretModel.setCaretsAndSelections(List) invocation.
        Specified by:
        getCaretsAndSelections in interface CaretModel
        See Also:
        CaretModel.setCaretsAndSelections(List)
